The effective diffusion area of the Franz cells was 59.6 ± 3.1 mm2.
Total diffusion after 6 h (mg/cm2) for Celgard was 67.28 ± 3.66.
Total diffusion reported after 6 hours.
The drug diffusion tests were undertaken on a validated tailor-made Franz cell.

title: Chitin-Glucan Complex Hydrogels: Physical-Chemical Characterization, Stability, In Vitro Drug Permeation, and Biological Assessment in Primary Cells.

evidence.snippet: 0.1 wt% ibuprofen solution used for loading.
The diffusion area is 3.14 cm².
Observed flux for ibuprofen was 4.26 µg/cm²/h.
10 mL receptor volume measured at hourly intervals.
In vitro permeation studies performed using Franz diffusion cell.

records.notes: No multiple formulations stated; this record is singular.

extraction_notes: Data extracted from numeric tables; only one formulation condition of ibuprofen was clearly detailed.

title: Cellulose Acetate and Polycaprolactone Fibre Coatings on Medical-Grade Metal Substrates for Controlled Drug Release

evidence.snippet: 1 mg of ibuprofen incorporated into both the CA and PCL solutions at a concentration of 0.5 g/L.
No specific numerical diffusion area mentioned, only that it was tested in membranes.
Endpoint value not directly stated; only qualitative data in figures.
Release tests performed over 190 h.
Membranes tested on medical-grade stainless steel substrates.

records.notes: Endpoint value appears only in figures without numeric values, hence set to null.
